newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end higher, driven up by chip shares.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end higher, driven up by chip shares.

text.p: Tokyo stocks closed higher on Wednesday, mainly encouraged by institutional investors' buying in the semiconductor sector. But many brokers said that the chip market has not yet bottomed out and that it was not likely to continue keeping the whole market afloat.
The key Nikkei 225 average gained 178.68 points or 0.84 percent to close at 21,350.67. Its December futures gained 210 points to end at 21,370.
"What led the stock market higher today were semiconductor-related shares," said a broker at a major Japanese securities house.
